questions.question_text:
VMware vRealize Suite Lifecycle Manager is deployed in VMware Cloud Foundation-aware mode, and the VMware Cloud Foundation version is 4.4 or higher.

A new release of VMware vRealize Automation is available with features the automation team requires.

What should the VCF administrator consider to upgrade?

choices.C: Upgrade vRealize Automation to the version requested by the automation team.
choices.B: Upgrade all vRealize Suite products managed by vRealize Suite Lifecycle Manager to the same version as vRealize Automation.
choices.A: Install the version of vRealize Automation that is contained in the VMware Cloud Foundation Bill of Materials.
choices.D: Install a version of vRealize Automation compatible with vRealize Suite Lifecycle Manager in the VMware Cloud Foundation Bill of Materials.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
no need to update all vRealize components

comments.content: vSAN is not External. That is in the question. They are asking for external services.

discussion.content:
vSAN, DHCP, and Syslog are important components, but they are not necessarily external services or dependencies specifically for a stretched-cluster implementation. These services may be managed within the VCF environment itself.

So, the correct options should be A, B, and C.

Selected Answer: BCE
dns and ntp required for basic config and dhcp required for stretched cluster

ABC & E are all potentially correct here. The actual question on the test will be different and only have 3 answers. NTP is required. DNS is always required. It's a VMware product. Dynamic Routing is being used here because it's stretched (most likely) and that means BGP and DHCP will be involved and required.

Selected Answer: BCE
BGP not required for SC. Only for the peering. NTP, DNS and DHCP for Host overlay addressing is correct

BCE is the correct answer, these are EXTERNAL services and are identified in the documentation
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Cloud-Foundation/5.1/vcf-design/GUID-AF68647A-37AB-4B8C-9402-BA9603947D4A.html

comments.content:
Desculpe , mandei o link errado.
Segue o link correro:
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Cloud-Foundation/3.10/com.vmware.vcf.planprep.doc_310/GUID-F022BD3C-F11C-4EE6-83EA-ABE016E7A9B9.html

questions.question_text:
A vSphere administrator is planning to deploy a new VMware Cloud Foundation environment and is tasked with identifying the necessary external services that will be required for a new stretched-cluster implementation.

Which three services should be considered as dependencies in this situation? (Choose three.)
Which option is supported to upgrade the ESXi 7.x hosts for a vSAN stretched cluster in a VMware Cloud Foundation environment?

discussion.content:
The correct answer is C. vRealize Suite Lifecycle Manager

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Cloud-Foundation/4.4/vcf-admin/GUID-E643CE2F-DE19-4A85-9AC3-F0D66B31F53A.html

comments.content: This is incorrect. vSAN is not a vRealize Suite product. It is a vSphere managed product.

questions.question_text: Which two switches can be used to perform log collection using the SoS tool? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
--psc and -- wcp is right. 
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Cloud-Foundation/4.5/vcf-admin/GUID-77C40307-8466-4331-A510-9334C0F6CF32.html
B --vcenter-logs is not an option for log collection using the sos tool. The correct answers are A and D, like Marco_vExpert and xniclas mentioned in their posts. Fix it!

comments.content:
Sorry guys the answer is C

I did the exercise again on Planning and Preparation Workbook 4.3 and 5.1. The same result.

discussion.content:
The answer is A

If you enable Developer Ready Infrastructure using VMware Cloud Foundation and enable Stretched Cluster for Workload Domain, the error says:

Cause: Management Stretched Cluster Required, but if you enable the Stretched Cluster in Management Domain, now the "Developer Ready Infrastructure using VMware Cloud Foundation" get the following error:

Cause: Not Supported with Stretched Cluster

Then the only one that makes sense is A. 

Verified in VMware Cloud Foundation Planning and Preparation Workbook.

Selected Answer: C
Confirmed with planning book, its C

choices.C: Identity and Access Management for VMware Cloud Foundation

questions.question_text:
During the design phase for a greenfield VMware Cloud Foundation (VCF) deployment, the following design decision has been agreed upon:

• Developer Ready Infrastructure needs to be deployed

The Infrastructure Architect is working with the client to fill the Planning and Preparation Workbook. The Option for ‘Developer Ready Infrastructure using VMware Cloud Foundation’ has been set to ‘Deploy’. The ‘Developer Ready Infrastructure using VMware Cloud Foundation’ is displaying an error, and its Final Result is stating ‘Excluded’.

Which option should be enabled in the Planning and Preparation Workbook to address this issue?
